intro: Iris florentina subsp. albicans, commonly known as the white flag iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features tall, slender stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, adorned with striking white to pale blue flowers. The plant has broad, sword-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green color. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing showy flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. This subspecies is well-suited for moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
